moves.2. c4: I opt for the Queen's Gambit.
moves.2... Nf6: This is inferior, as his knight gets kicked around. Better is e6 or c6.
moves.4. e4: I attack the knight, and seize the centre.
moves.4... Nb6: f6 was a better square, where he attacks the e pawn.
moves.6. Be3: Developing the bishop, and also discouraging c7-c5 which attacks my centre.
moves.7. Bd3: If he takes on d4 now, I take back, and if he recaptures with the queen he loses it to Bb5 check.
moves.7... Bb4: Another inaccuracy as an exchange on c3 simply strengthens my centre.
moves.8. f4: I prevent the other pawn break by him - e7-e5.
moves.8... Ne7: Not sure why he played this?
moves.9. Nf3: I develop my last minor piece.
moves.9... h6: Again I think this is rather a waste of a move.
moves.10. O-O: I castle, bringing my king to safety and my Rh1 into play.
moves.10... a6: I mirror of h6 perhaps, but again, not helping his development.
moves.11. a3: Now he is forced to take as Ba5 loses the bishop to b2-b4 and Bd6 to e4-e5
moves.12... Bd7: and he finally develops his bishop.
moves.13. a4: I want to drive back his Nb6. Maybe I can have pressure on the b file by moves like Ra1-b1 attacking b7, after his knight goes.
moves.13... Bc6: He puts the bishop on a more active square.
moves.14... Qd7: Attacking a4, but taking away a square from his bishop.
moves.16. d5: And now his bishop, which is running out of squares.
moves.17. exd5: Normally people are advised to take towards the centre, but it would be a massive mistake to take with the c pawn here, as it would give him b5 for his bishop.
moves.17... Bxd5: As he is losing it, he may as well get 2 pawns for it.
moves.19. Bc5: I decide to sacrifice a pawn to prevent him castling.
moves.21. Nd4: I put more pressure on his knight.
moves.21... Kd8: I find this a strange move.
moves.23. Rxe6: I was really pleased to find this! Now if he takes, Bf5 discovers check from my Qd1 and hence wins his queen.
moves.23... Nd6: So he blocks the d file.
moves.24. Rxd6: I decide to sacrifice the exchange for a mating attack.
moves.25... Kc8: The king runs. I have to find a good move, otherwise he may grovel out with Kb8 and Rc8.
moves.26. Bf5: I sacrifice again, although after the game, checking the ending on Fritz, I found out that Rc1 also wins.
moves.26... Qxf5: He is almost forced to take.
moves.27... Qd7: Qc2 is a tougher defence, but still loses to Rd1 check, threatening the queen sacrifice Qd8+, mating.
moves.30. Qc7#:
Only to be mated.

Many thanks for reading. Please rate this on the star system and leave a comment or two to let me know how I am doing.
